decision_conditions: <p><span id="docs-internal-guid-6094fefb-7fff-3f0c-f1ef-ad304259f0ea"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">By reason of the inappropriate scale and positioning of the proposed doors and Juliet balcony, and the second floor roof terrace to the rear elevation, the proposed alterations would result in an incongruous development which would adversely detract from the character and appearance of the existing building as well as the architectural integrity of the wider row of terraced properties of which the application site forms part. Subsequently, the proposed development would harm the significance of the Brownswood Conservation Area. This identified less than substantial harm would not be outweighed by any public benefits. The proposed development would, therefore, conflict with Policies LP1 and LP3 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).</span></span><br></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-c6b42847-7fff-6991-2dae-5288c7237d79"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">By reason of the scale, off-centre positioning and detailed design of the proposed mansard roof extension, the mansard roof extension would result in a poorly designed, overly dominant and discordant roof level enlargement that would be harmful to the character and appearance of the existing property and roofscape of the row of terraced properties as well as harm the significance of the Brownswood Conservation Area. This identified less than substantial harm would not be outweighed by any public benefits. The proposed development would, therefore conflict with Policies LP1 and LP3 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020); the National Planning Policy Framework (2023); and the guidance as contained within the Residential Alterations and Extensions SPD (2023).</span></span><br></p>

<p>B<span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10.5pt; white-space-collapse: preserve;">y reason of their number and positioning to the front roof slope, the proposed Solar PV Panels would result in highly visible alteration to the roofscape to the detriment of the character and appearance of the host property and row of terraced properties within the Brownswood Conservation Area. The less than substantial harm to the significance to the Brownswood Conservation Area would not be outweighed by any public benefits. The proposed development would, therefore, conflict with Policies LP1 and LP3 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).</span></p>

<p>I<span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10.5pt; white-space-collapse: preserve;">n the absence of a Noise Impact Assessment having been submitted, it has failed to be demonstrated that the proposed Air Source Heat Pump would not give rise to undue noise or disturbance to the detriment of the amenity of occupiers of neighbouring properties. The proposed development would, therefore, conflict with Policy LP2 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020).</span></p>
description: Erection of single storey ground floor rear extension with elevational alterations including conversion of rear windows to double doors and replacement of windows. Upper storey works include the removal of the mono-pitched roof of the existing rear outrigger and replace with a roof terrace with privacy screen, and dormer loft extension. Works to the front include reinstalling brick wall and metal fence and the installation of solar panels to the front roof slope.
